intro: Prunus jamasakura f. racemosa, commonly known as the Japanese cherry blossom or sakura, is a cultivar of the Prunus jamasakura species. It is characterized by its profuse, showy clusters of white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is a deciduous shrub or small tree, typically reaching heights of 3 to 5 meters. Its leaves are oval-shaped with serrated edges, turning yellow in the fall. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
